Interface HoldSecurityaccountSecurityJpaRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<HoldSecurityaccountSecurity,HoldSecurityaccountSecurityKey>, HoldSecurityaccountSecurityJpaRepositoryCustom, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<HoldSecurityaccountSecurity,HoldSecurityaccountSecurityKey>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<HoldSecurityaccountSecurity,HoldSecurityaccountSecurityKey>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<HoldSecurityaccountSecurity,HoldSecurityaccountSecurityKey>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<HoldSecurityaccountSecurity,HoldSecurityaccountSecurityKey>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<HoldSecurityaccountSecurity>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<HoldSecurityaccountSecurity,HoldSecurityaccountSecurityKey>

    • getBuySellTransWithSecuritySplitByIdSecurityaccount

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<HoldSecurityaccountSecurityJpaRepository.ITransactionSecuritySplit> getBuySellTransWithSecuritySplitByIdSecurityaccount(Integer idSecurityaccount)
      Retrieves aggregated buy/sell transaction units and security split ratios for each security within the specified security custody account.
      • Filters by Securityaccount ID (?1), referencing the Securitycashaccount base entity.
      • For direct‐investment instruments (DIRECT_INVESTMENT, ETF, MUTUAL_FUND, PENSION_FUNDS): sums net units per date (positive for buys, negative for sells).
      • For margin instruments (CFD, FOREX): computes factorUnits as ±(units * assetInvestmentValue2) and retains idTransactionMargin for margin tracking.
      • Includes security split events for any traded security, computing split ratio (to_factor/from_factor).
      Results are combined via UNION and ordered by security ID and event date.
      Parameters:
      idSecurityaccount - the ID of the security custody account (Securityaccount)
      Returns:
      a list of ITransactionSecuritySplit projections with one entry per security and date

    • getBuySellTransWithSecuritySplitByIdSecurityaccountAndSecurity

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<HoldSecurityaccountSecurityJpaRepository.ITransactionSecuritySplit> getBuySellTransWithSecuritySplitByIdSecurityaccountAndSecurity(Integer idSecurityaccount, Integer idSecuritycurrency)
      Retrieves aggregated buy/sell transaction units and security split factors for the given security cash account and security.
      • For ACCUMULATE (4) and REDUCE (5) transactions: sums units per date, positive for buys and negative for sells.
      • For security split events: computes split ratio (to_factor / from_factor).
      The results are combined via UNION and ordered by the event date.
      Parameters:
      idSecurityaccount - the ID of the security cash account
      idSecuritycurrency - the ID of the security
      Returns:
      a list of ITransactionSecuritySplit projections with one entry per date

    • getBuySellTransWithSecuritySplitByIdSecurityaccountAndSecurityMargin

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<HoldSecurityaccountSecurityJpaRepository.ITransactionSecuritySplit> getBuySellTransWithSecuritySplitByIdSecurityaccountAndSecurityMargin(Integer idSecurityaccount, Integer idSecuritycurrency)
      Retrieves a combined list of buy/sell transactions and security splits for the given security account and security. - Selects transactions of type ACCUMULATE (4) and REDUCE (5), calculating factorUnits as ±(units * assetInvestmentValue2). - Unions with security splits, computing factorUnits as split ratio (to_factor/from_factor). - Orders all entries by timestamp (transaction_time or split_date).
      Parameters:
      idSecurityaccount - the ID of the security cash account
      idSecuritycurrency - the ID of the security
      Returns:
      a list of ITransactionSecuritySplit projections containing transaction or split details

    • getPeriodHoldingsByTenant

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<IPeriodHolding> getPeriodHoldingsByTenant(Integer idTenant, LocalDate dateFrom, LocalDate dateTo)
      Retrieves daily aggregated tenant holdings for the specified tenant and date range. - Calculates aggregated values of security positions, margin gains, and market risk when all required quotes are available. - Summarizes cash deposits, dividends, interest, and fees (negated) from tenant cash account balances. - Applies currency conversion to tenant currency using historical quotes. - Includes external cash transfers to compute net gain per day.
      Parameters:
      idTenant - the ID of the tenant
      dateFrom - the start date of the period (inclusive)
      dateTo - the end date of the period (inclusive)
      Returns:
      a list of IPeriodHolding projections with daily performance metrics

    • getPeriodHoldingsByPortfolio

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<IPeriodHolding> getPeriodHoldingsByPortfolio(Integer idPortfolio, LocalDate dateFrom, LocalDate dateTo)
      Retrieves daily aggregated portfolio holdings for the specified portfolio and date range. - Calculates security position values, margin gains, and market risk when all required quotes are available. - Summarizes cash deposits, dividends, interest, and fees (negated) from cash account balances. - Applies currency conversion to portfolio currency using historical quotes. - Includes external cash transfers to compute net gain per day.
      Parameters:
      idPortfolio - the ID of the portfolio
      dateFrom - the start date of the period (inclusive)
      dateTo - the end date of the period (inclusive)
      Returns:
      a list of IPeriodHolding projections with daily performance metrics

    • getMissingQuotesForSecurityByTenantAndPeriod

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<HoldSecurityaccountSecurityJpaRepository.DateSecurityQuoteMissing> getMissingQuotesForSecurityByTenantAndPeriod(Integer idTenant, LocalDate dateFrom, LocalDate dateTo)
      Retrieves all trading dates and security IDs for which no end-of-day quote exists for securities held by the specified tenant within the given period.
      • Scans official trading days (excluding shifted days) per security’s exchange.
      • Filters to securities actively held by the tenant in their security accounts.
      • Excludes exchanges with no market value and securities outside their active date range.
      • Identifies missing quotes where no historyquote record exists for that date.
      Parameters:
      idTenant - the tenant ID to scope held securities
      dateFrom - the start date of the period (inclusive)
      dateTo - the end date of the period (inclusive)
      Returns:
      a list of DateSecurityQuoteMissing projections containing tradingDate and idSecuritycurrency

    • getByISINAndSecurityAccountAndDate

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<HoldSecurityaccountSecurity> getByISINAndSecurityAccountAndDate(String isin, Integer idSecurityaccount, Date transactinDate)
      Retrieves all hold records for a security with the given ISIN in the specified security account that are active on the provided transaction date.

      Joins the hold_securityaccount_security table with Security to filter by ISIN, and ensures the transaction date falls within the hold period (from_hold_date ≤ date ≤ to_hold_date).

      Parameters:
      isin - the ISIN of the security
      idSecurityaccount - the ID of the security account
      transactionDate - the date to check for an active hold
      Returns:
      a list of HoldSecurityaccountSecurity entities matching the criteria

    • getMissingsQuoteDaysByTenant

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) Set<Date> getMissingsQuoteDaysByTenant(Integer idTenant)
      Retrieves all unique trading dates on which at least one security held by the specified tenant has no end-of-day quote. Trading days which can't used for calculation of tenants portfolio performance, because historical data for one or more security holding are not available.

      - Scans official trading days for each held security’s exchange, excluding shifted days.
      - Joins to tenant’s held securities and filters by active hold periods.
      - Excludes exchanges flagged as having no market value and securities outside their active date range.
      - Selects dates where no Historyquote record exists for the security on that trading day.

      Parameters:
      idTenant - the ID of the tenant whose held securities are checked
      Returns:
      a set of trading dates with missing quotes across all held securities

    • getMissingsQuoteDaysByPortfolio

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) Set<Date> getMissingsQuoteDaysByPortfolio(Integer idPortfolio)
      Retrieves all unique trading dates on which at least one security held in the specified portfolio has no end-of-day quote.

      - Scans official trading days for each security’s exchange, excluding shifted days.
      - Joins to the portfolio’s held securities and filters by active hold periods.
      - Excludes exchanges without market value and securities outside their active date range.
      - Selects dates where no Historyquote record exists for a held security on that trading day.

      Parameters:
      idPortfolio - the ID of the portfolio whose held securities are checked
      Returns:
      a set of trading dates with missing quotes across all securities in the portfolio

    • getCombinedHolidayOfHoldingsByTenant

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) Set<Date> getCombinedHolidayOfHoldingsByTenant(Integer idTenant)
      Retrieves all unique “combined holiday” dates for securities held by the given tenant.

      This query looks up each security’s official trading calendar, including any adjusted (minus) dates, and then filters to those dates that fall within the tenant’s active hold periods. Only exchanges with market value are considered, and results are limited to dates on or before today.

      Parameters:
      idTenant - the ID of the tenant whose held securities are checked
      Returns:
      a set of dates representing combined holiday adjustments (holdDate) for the tenant’s active holdings

    • getCombinedHolidayOfHoldingsByPortfolio

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) Set<Date> getCombinedHolidayOfHoldingsByPortfolio(Integer idPortfolio)
      Retrieves all unique “combined holiday” dates for securities held in the specified portfolio.

      - Scans each held security’s official trading calendar, including any minus‐day adjustments (trading_days_minus).
      - Filters to hold periods for the portfolio (from_hold_date ≤ date ≤ to_hold_date or open‐ended).
      - Considers only exchanges with market value and dates up to today.
      - Returns each adjusted trading date (holdDate) where the portfolio holds the security.

      Parameters:
      idPortfolio - the ID of the portfolio whose held securities are checked
      Returns:
      a set of dates representing combined holiday adjustments for the portfolio’s active holdings

    • getIdSecurityByIdTenantWithHoldings

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<Integer> getIdSecurityByIdTenantWithHoldings(Integer idTenant)
      Retrieves the IDs of all securities currently held by the specified tenant.

      Queries the `hold_securityaccount_security` table for records where:

      • `id_tenant` matches the given tenant
      • `to_hold_date` is NULL, indicating an active hold
      Parameters:
      idTenant - the tenant ID whose active security holdings are to be fetched
      Returns:
      a list of securitycurrency IDs representing securities still held by the tenant

    • getHoldSecuritySplitTransactionBySecurity

      @Query(value="CALL holdSecuritySplitTransaction(:idSecurity);", nativeQuery=true) List<HoldSecurityaccountSecurityJpaRepository.IHoldSecuritySplitTransactionBySecurity> getHoldSecuritySplitTransactionBySecurity(@Param("idSecurity") Integer idSecurity)
      Executes the `holdSecuritySplitTransaction` stored procedure to produce a unified, chronological list of buy/sell transactions and split events for the specified security—excluding any margin trades.

      Each returned projection includes:

      • Tenant and portfolio IDs (getIdTenant, getIdPortfolio)
      • Security-account ID (getIdSecurityaccount)
      • Event timestamp (getTsDate) – transaction time or split date
      • Computed factor units (getFactorUnits) – total units for buys/sells or split ratio
      • Tenant and portfolio currency codes (getTenantCurrency, getPorfolioCurrency)
      • Margin-transaction ID (getIdTransactionMargin) – always null, since margin trades are omitted
      Parameters:
      idSecurity - the identifier of the security whose buy/sell and split events to fetch
      Returns:
      a list of HoldSecurityaccountSecurityJpaRepository.IHoldSecuritySplitTransactionBySecurity projections containing transaction and split details in ascending timestamp order

    • getHoldSecuritySplitMarginTransactionBySecurity

      @Query(value="CALL holdSecuritySplitMarginTransaction(:idSecurity);", nativeQuery=true) List<HoldSecurityaccountSecurityJpaRepository.IHoldSecuritySplitTransactionBySecurity> getHoldSecuritySplitMarginTransactionBySecurity(@Param("idSecurity") Integer idSecurity)
      Executes the `holdSecuritySplitMarginTransaction` stored procedure to produce a unified, chronological sequence of margin transactions and split events for a given security.

      Each returned projection includes:

      • Tenant and portfolio identifiers (getIdTenant, getIdPortfolio)
      • Security account identifier (getIdSecurityaccount)
      • Event timestamp (getTsDate) – transaction time or split date
      • Computed factor units (getFactorUnits) – ±(units × value) for margin trades or split ratio for splits
      • Tenant and portfolio currency codes (getTenantCurrency, getPorfolioCurrency)
      • Margin transaction ID (getIdTransactionMargin), present only for margin trades
      Parameters:
      idSecurity - the identifier of the security for which to fetch margin and split events
      Returns:
      a list of HoldSecurityaccountSecurityJpaRepository.IHoldSecuritySplitTransactionBySecurity projections containing detailed event and currency information
